datafield.subfield: An ultracold, optically trapped mixture of$^{87}$Rb and metastable$^{4}$He atoms

We report on the realization of an ultracold (<25 μK) mixture of rubidium ($^{87}$Rb) and metastable triplet helium ($^{4}$He) in an optical dipole trap. Our scheme involves laser cooling in a dual-species magneto-optical trap, simultaneous MW- and RF-induced forced evaporative cooling in a quadrupole magnetic trap, and transfer to a single-beam optical dipole trap. We observe long trapping lifetimes for the doubly spin-stretched spin-state mixture and measure much shorter lifetimes for other spin-state combinations. We discuss prospects for realizing quantum degenerate mixtures of alkali-metal and metastable helium atoms.
